attributes.action: Reduce deductions taken out of Universal Credit for people working part time
attributes.additional_details:
UC was designed to allow claimants to take part-time work without losing their entitlement altogether. It was also said that it makes claimants better off taking on work, as they keep at least a proportion of the money they earn but most claimants doing part time hours or on a zero hour contract, will be worse off once they have paid for their travel and Council Tax.

Due to these large deductions, part-time work may no longer pay and some people would be better off refusing part-time work.
attributes.background:
People claiming Universal Credit and working part time or on a zero hour contract are getting their payments reduced by 63 pence for each £1.00 they earn in take-home pay.

These deductions should be reduced to help with travel to / from work and Council Tax which UC claimants still have to pay.
